body_html:
initialize_or_restore() on the status object returned by restore() will initialize anything that wasn't restored (assuming it's in the dependency graph). Does that work for you?

Example usage:

tensorflow/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable_utils.py

Line 954 in 2b42a06

status.initialize_or_restore(session)

initialize_or_restore documentation:

tensorflow/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable_utils.py

def initialize_or_restore(self, session=None):

body:
`initialize_or_restore()` on the status object returned by `restore()` will initialize anything that wasn't restored (assuming it's in the dependency graph). Does that work for you?

Example usage: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/2b42a0620f45cc40c3cc96552c565271bfed0c82/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable_utils.py#L954

`initialize_or_restore` documentation: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/2b42a0620f45cc40c3cc96552c565271bfed0c82/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable_utils.py#L531
